mods:mods.mods:abstract: These tales reveal an enormous amount about Japanese culture, while the inner struggles of the characters always strike the universal.

mods:recordInfo.mods:recordOrigin: Converted from MARCXML to MODS version 3.6 using MARC21slim2MODS3-6.xsl (Revision 1.117 2017/02/14)

mods:mods.mods:abstract: "Akutagawa (1892-1927) was one of Japan's foremost stylists - a modernist master whose stories are marked by original imagery, cynicism, beauty and wild humour. Including both famous and little-known works, some translated into English for the first time, this volume reveals Akutagawa in a new light. In his introduction, Haruki Murakami explores Akutagawa's place in Japanese culture and influence on his own writing, while Jay Rubin's translations capture the spirit of the originals."--Cover.
mods:mods.mods:tableOfContents: World in decay. Rashōmon -- In a bamboo grove -- Nose -- Dragon : the old potter's tale -- Spider thread -- Hell screen -- Under the sword. Dr. Ogata Ryōsai : memorandum -- O-gin -- Loyalty -- Story of a head that fell off -- Green onions -- Horse legs -- Akutagawa's own story -- Daidōji Shinsuke : the early years -- Writer's craft -- Baby's sickness -- Death register -- Life of a stupid man -- Spinning gears.
mods:mods.mods:note: Ryūnosuke Akutagawa ; selected and translated with notes by Jay Rubin ; with an introduction by Haruki Murakami.
Includes bibliographical references (p. [xxxviii]-xl).
Translated from the Japanese.

mods:mods.mods:abstract: A collection of short stories from Ryunosuke Akutagawa, one of Japan's foremost stylists, a master of the modern idiom enriched by a deep knowledge of both the classics and the contemporary literature of Japan, China, and the West.
mods:mods.mods:tableOfContents: Rashom̄on -- In a bamboo grove -- The nose -- Dragon: the old potter's tale -- The spider thread -- Hell screen -- Dr. Ogata Ryos̄ai: memorandum -- O-gin -- Loyalty -- The story of a head that fell off -- Green onions -- Horse legs -- Daidoj̄i Shinsuke: the early years -- The writer's craft -- The baby's sickness -- Death register -- The life of a stupid man -- Spinning gears.
mods:mods.mods:note: Ryūnosuke Akutagawa ; selected and translated with notes by Jay Rubin ; with an introduction by Haruki Murakami.
Includes bibliographical references (p. [237]-268).

Previous edition published under the title Exotic Japanese Stories: the beautiful and the grotesque.
